description: '''Rachid Baba Ahmed''' ({{langx|ar|رشيد بابا أحمد}}; 20 August 1946–15 February 1995) was an Algerian record producer, composer, and singer involved in the regional [[musical genre|genre]] known as [[raï]]. He was credited with the international popularization of the genre in 1976, through the new pop raï, with a delicate and sophisticated blend of electronic instrumentation. He was also credited with the development of pop raï during the 1970s and 1980s,<sup>[[#Notes|1]]</sup> the performers of which are called ''cheb'' or ''chaba''.
